data.chText: （数量、价值、质量等的）减少，下降，衰落，衰退
data.enText: a continuous decrease in the number, value, quality, etc. of sth

data.chText: 迅速 / 急剧 / 逐渐下降
data.enText: a rapid/sharp/gradual decline
urban/economic decline

data.chText: 公司报告其利润略有减少。
data.enText: The company reported a small decline in its profits.

data.chText: 汽车的增加导致了公共交通的减少。
data.enText: An increase in cars has resulted in the decline of public transport.

data.chText: 这个镇在矿井关闭后开始衰落。
data.enText: The town fell into (a) decline (= started to be less busy, important, etc.) after the mine closed.

data.chText: 英国工业自20世纪70年代以来一直在走下坡路。
data.enText: Industry in Britain has been in decline since the 1970s.
to become smaller, fewer, weaker, etc.

data.chText: 对该党的支持继续下降。
data.enText: Support for the party continues to decline.

data.chText: 去年到这个胜地旅游的人数减少了10%。
data.enText: The number of tourists to the resort declined by 10% last year.

data.chText: 她的健康状况迅速恶化。
data.enText: Her health was declining rapidly.
to refuse politely to accept or to do sth

data.chText: 我主动邀请他们搭车，但他们婉言谢绝了。
data.enText: I offered to give them a lift but they declined.

data.chText: 谢绝对方的主动帮助 / 邀请
data.enText: to decline an offer/invitation

data.chText: 他们的发言人拒绝对这些指控加以评论。
data.enText: Their spokesman declined to comment on the allegations.

data.chText: （根据名词、形容词或代词在句中的作用）变格，使发生词形变化
data.enText: if a noun, an adjective or a pronoun declines , it has different forms according to whether it is the subject or the object of a verb, whether it is in the singular or plural, etc. When you decline a noun, etc., you list these forms.
sb's declining years
the last years of sb's life

simple_means.memory_skill: de 向下 + clin 倾斜 + e → 向下倾斜 → 衰退

means: (数量、价值、质量等的)减少，下降，衰落，衰退
(根据名词、形容词或代词在句中的作用)变格，使发生词形变化

ex.enText: He was denied entry to the country.

synonyms.bx: 指不允许某人拥有某物或做某事。

ex.chText: 我夫人谢绝了格林太太的晚宴邀请。
ex.enText: My wife declined Mrs. Green's invitation to dinner.

ex.chText: 布朗先生虽然很穷，却谢绝了慈善团体的一大笔捐款。
ex.enText: Poor as he was, Mr. Brown declined a large sum of money from the charity.

ex.chText: 我们同意让他搭车，但是他却谢绝了。
ex.enText: We agreed to offer him a lift but he declined.

synonyms.bx: 指婉言谢绝他人的帮助、邀请等。

ex.chText: 她断然拒绝了他所有的友好表示。
ex.enText: She rebuffed all his offers of friendship.

synonyms.bx: 指很不友好地拒绝别人善意的建议或帮助。

ex.chText: 她拒绝一个人到那里去。
ex.enText: She refused to go there alone.

ex.chText: 她叫他一起来，但是他拒绝了。
ex.enText: She asked him to come with her, but he refused.
He refused a second cup of coffee.

ex.chText: 这个建议太好了，让人难以拒绝。
ex.enText: The suggestion seems too good to refuse/turn down.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指拒绝做某事或接受别人所给之物，作后者解时常可与turn down 换用。

ex.chText: 他对要求他辞职的呼声置之不理。
ex.enText: He rejected calls for his resignation.

ex.chText: 我弟弟因为视力不好未能参军。
ex.enText: My brother was rejected by the army because of his poor eyesight.

synonyms.bx: 指拒绝接受或考虑某事，或指由于不能让人满意而不接受、不录取等。

data.enText: sb's declining years
the last years of sb's life

tr: as of stored charge or current
change toward something smaller or lower
a condition inferior to an earlier condition
a gradual falling off from a better state

example: he declined to join the group on a hike

tr: inflect for number, gender, case, etc., "in many languages, speakers decline nouns, pronouns, and adjectives"

example: He refused my offer of hospitality

value.def: If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength.

example.ex: The number of staff has declined from 217,000 to 114,000...
example.tran: 员工人数从 21.7万减少到了11.4万。

example.ex: Hourly output by workers declined 1.3% in the first quarter...
example.tran: 第一季度工人每小时的产量下降了 1.3%。

example.ex: Union membership and union power are declining fast.
example.tran: 工会的人数和力量都在迅速萎缩。
呈下降态势的人口出生率

value.def: If you decline something or decline to do something, you politely refuse to accept it or do it.

example.ex: The band declined to comment on the story...
example.tran: 乐队拒绝对这一报道作任何评论。

example.ex: He offered the boys some coffee. They declined politely.
example.tran: 他问那些小伙子要不要来点咖啡，他们婉辞了。

value.def: If there is a decline in something, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or quality.

example.ex: There wasn't such a big decline in enrollments after all...
example.tran: 注册人数终究还是没有出现如此大幅度的下降。
公元5世纪时罗马的衰落

example.ex: The first signs of economic decline became visible.
example.tran: 经济衰退的最初迹象开始显现出来。

gramarinfo.label: oft N with poss, N <l>in</l> n

value.def: If something is in decline or on the decline, it is gradually decreasing in importance, quality, or power.

example.ex: Thankfully the smoking of cigarettes is on the decline...
example.tran: 令人欣慰的是，吸烟量在逐渐下降。

example.ex: He is still one of the world's most popular golfers, but his game is in decline.
example.tran: 他仍是世界上最受欢迎的高尔夫球选手之一，但他的球技日不如前。

value.def: If something goes or falls into decline, it begins to gradually decrease in importance, quality, or power.

example.ex: Libraries are an investment for the future and they should not be allowed to fall into decline.
example.tran: 图书馆是对未来的一项投资，不应任其日趋萎缩。

trans: 衰落与瓦解；衰亡；罗马帝国衰亡史；没落与堕落

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + cliv 倾斜；斜坡 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 上斜坡 → 上〔行〕坡
ac 表加强 + cliv 倾斜；斜坡 + ous …的 → 上斜的
de 向下 + clin 倾斜；斜坡 + e → 向下倾斜 → 衰退
de 向下 + cliv 倾斜；斜坡 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 下斜，倾斜
dis 不 + inclined 倾向于 → 不愿的，不喜欢的
in 使… + clin 倾斜；斜坡 + e → 倾斜；倾向
inclin〔e〕倾斜；倾向 + ed 表形容词 → 倾向于…的
pro 向前 + cliv 倾斜；斜坡 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 向前斜 → 倾向
re 回 + clin 倾斜；斜坡 + e → 斜过去 → 斜倚
